description.narrative: (Pakistan): Utilizing FY15 funds, USAID plans to extend the Gender Equity Program (GEP). To close the gender gap in Pakistan, GEP facilitates behavioral change in society by enabling women to access information, resources, and institutions and improving public attitudes around women's rights. GEP uses small grants to work with the GOP and NGOs to create an enabling environment to enhance women's access to justice, expand economic opportunities, advocate for women's social and political empowerment, support survivors of gender-based violence, and build the capacity of government and civil society to prevent, respond, and eliminate gender Based Violence (GBV).In FY15, GEP plans to award a total of 26 sub-grants in three thematic grant cycles: 1) empowerment of women and women's institutions; 2) expanding women's access to justice; and 3) engagement with public universities. GEP will also manage 93 sub-grants in various stages of implementation. GEP will continue hosting capacity building workshops for sub-grantees, strengthen the Pakistan Gender Coalition, and continue media outreach campaigns.

participating-org.narrative: Aurat Publication and Information Service Foundation
